result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer J. Lafernier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jennifer J. Lafernier
Current: 615 W Keefe Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2017)
Prior: 615 W Keefe Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Jennifer J. Lafernier
Current: 615 W Keefe Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2017)
Prior: C/o Trempealeau County Jail  P O Box 67, Trempealeau, WI 54773

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Victim notification complied with.  Victim is present.  Court concerned that probation is being offered again.  State advised that the defendant has been accepted into Trempealeau County's treatment court.  Attorney Sebion spoke.  Court wants a PSI.  She can plead today.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 15CF106.

Pre-trial conference at 09-30-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-19-2015 03:00 pm.

Covers 15CF106 and 15CM219.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  with Moe's Hardware, or the Moe family, or their residence. Report for booking.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Reading of complaint waived.  NGP entered.  PTC 9/30/15 & STC 10/19/15 at 3 pm.
